assignments.title: Self-assessment: identify weak areas (speaking, grammar, vocabulary) and set measurable goals
Review B1 essentials: present/past tenses, separable verbs, word order basics; short diagnostic quiz
Speaking practice: introduce yourself professionally (2-minute pitch) and give structured opinions (weil/denn/deshalb)
Narrate daily routines with time markers and connectors (zuerst, danach, schließlich)
Grammar focus: verb position in main/subordinate clauses; practice with dass/weil/ob
Role play: making plans, changing appointments, giving reasons and alternatives
Role play: buying tickets, asking for directions, dealing with delays or lost items
Grammar focus: two-way prepositions (Wechselpräpositionen) and cases in location vs direction
Write and speak: describe a trip using Präteritum/Perfekt appropriately and add details (Adjektive/Adverbien)
Describe your apartment and neighborhood with precise vocabulary and comparisons
Grammar focus: adjective endings (all cases) + comparative/superlative
Speaking: discuss family roles, friendships, and conflict resolution using modal verbs and softeners

week_or_day: Week 5 - Work basics: tasks, meetings, priorities

assignments.title: Vocabulary: workplace roles, departments, tasks; build a personal work glossary
Speaking role play: daily stand-up / status update (what you did, what you will do, blockers)
Grammar focus: modal verbs in past (ich musste/konnte) and polite requests

week_or_day: Week 6 - Professional communication: emails & phone calls

assignments.title: Write: formal emails (request, follow-up, complaint) with correct register and structure
Role play: phone calls—clarifying, taking messages, confirming details
Grammar focus: Konjunktiv II for politeness (könnte, hätte, wäre) and indirect questions
Speaking: structured discussion on a current topic (pros/cons, examples, conclusion)
Grammar focus: connectors and argumentation phrases (einerseits/andererseits, dennoch, außerdem, deshalb)
Listening/summary: watch a short report and give a 60–90 second spoken summary
Role play: doctor’s appointment, describing symptoms, asking follow-up questions
Grammar focus: reflexive verbs and verb-preposition combinations (sich beschweren über, leiden an)
Speaking: give advice using sollte/müsste/wäre besser and explain consequences
Speaking: describe your learning path, strengths/weaknesses, and future goals (SMART goals)
Write: CV/LinkedIn-style profile and a short motivation message for a job/course
Grammar focus: noun-verb collocations and nominalization (z.B. die Entscheidung treffen)
Discuss a film/book/podcast: plot, characters, themes, and personal opinion
Grammar focus: relative clauses (der/die/das, wo, was) and participle adjectives
Storytelling: tell a personal story with suspense using connectors and time shifts

week_or_day: Week 11 - Workplace scenarios: conflict, negotiation & presentations

assignments.title: Role play: handling misunderstandings, giving feedback, and negotiating deadlines
Prepare and deliver a 5–7 minute presentation about your work/project with Q&A
Grammar focus: passive voice (Vorgangspassiv/Zustandspassiv) and formal phrasing
B2 speaking simulation: discussion + problem-solving task + short presentation
Grammar consolidation: targeted review of your top 5 error patterns with drills and corrections
Writing: B2-style text (email/report/opinion) + self-editing checklist (cohesion, register, grammar)
